content:
TITLE: Configuring ESLint Parser Options for TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: Configuration for enabling type-aware lint rules in ESLint with TypeScript. Sets up parser options to specify TypeScript configuration files and root directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/templates/react-vite-ts/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
export default tseslint.config({
  languageOptions: {
    // other options...
    parserOptions: {
      project: ['./tsconfig.node.json', './tsconfig.app.json'],
      tsconfigRootDir: import.meta.dirname,
    },
  },
})
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing and Using RichText Component in React
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to import the RichText component from the experiences-components-react package and use it in a React component to render rich text content.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/components/src/components/RichText/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
import { RichText } from '@contentful/experiences-components-react';

const MyPage = () => <RichText value={document} />;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing and Using Heading Component in React
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to import the Heading component from @contentful/experiences-components-react and use it in a React component.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/components/src/components/Heading/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
import { Heading } from '@contentful/experiences-components-react';

const MyPage = () => <Heading>Hello world</Heading>;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing and Using the Image Component in React
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to import the Image component from @contentful/experiences-components-react and implement it in a React component. The example shows basic usage with source URL and alt text properties.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/components/src/components/Image/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
import { Image } from '@contentful/experiences-components-react';

const MyPage = () => <Image src="https://mysite.com/assets/image.png" alt="My Image" />;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Text Component Usage in React/TSX
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the basic implementation of the Text component with a simple value prop.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/components/src/components/Text/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
import { Text } from '@contentful/experiences-components-react';

const MyPage = () => <Text value="Go" />;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Custom Component Variables in Contentful Experience Builder
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to define variables for custom components in the Contentful Experience Builder. This snippet shows how to set custom default values for styling properties like margins, which will be available in the Design sidebar of the Experiences UI.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/components/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
  variables: {
    cfMargin: {
      displayName: 'Margin',
      type: 'Text',
      group: 'style',
      description: 'The margin of the button.',
      defaultValue: '4px',
    },
  }
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Button Component Usage in React
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to import and use the Button component from the Contentful experiences components library. This example shows using the component with a label and URL for navigation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/components/src/components/Button/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
import { Button } from '@contentful/experiences-components-react';

const MyPage = () => <Button label="Go" url="https://www.contentful.com" />;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Storybook Story with Contentful Experience Builder
DESCRIPTION: This TypeScript code demonstrates how to create a Storybook story for a Button component, incorporating the Contentful Experience Builder addon. It includes the component definition and story configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/storybook-addon/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import type { Meta, StoryObj } from '@storybook/react';

import Button from '../components/atoms/Button';

const meta = {
  title: 'Example/Button',
  component: Button,
  parameters: {
    // Required to view component definition changes in Storybook
    experienceBuilder: Button.ComponentDefinition,
  },
} satisfies Meta<typeof Button>;

export default meta;
type Story = StoryObj<typeof meta>;

export const Default: Story = {
  args: {
    targetUrl: '/en',
    variant: 'default',
    label: 'Button',
  },
};
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Custom HTML Tag with 'as' Prop
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to specify a custom HTML tag for the RichText component using the 'as' prop, which allows rendering the content within different HTML elements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/components/src/components/RichText/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
<RichText as="span" value={document} />
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Custom Navigation Handling with onNavigate Prop
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the onNavigate prop to handle URL navigation programmatically instead of using the default behavior. This allows for custom routing or navigation interception.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/components/src/components/Button/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
<Button
  url="https://www.google.com"
  target="_blank"
  onNavigate={(url, target) => {
    // dev can now do route via code
  }}
  label="Go"
/>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying Heading Type in Heading Component
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the type prop to specify the heading level (h1-h6) in the Heading component.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/components/src/components/Heading/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
<Heading type="h2">My Heading</Heading>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Providing Rich Text Document Structure
DESCRIPTION: Example of providing the complete document structure to the RichText component, including document nodes, paragraph blocks, and text content with their corresponding data and type information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/components/src/components/RichText/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
<RichText
  value={{
    nodeType: BLOCKS.DOCUMENT,
    data: {},
    content: [
      {
        nodeType: BLOCKS.PARAGRAPH,
        data: {},
        content: [{ nodeType: 'text', value: 'abc', marks: [], data: {} }],
      },
    ],
  }}
/>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Registering Legacy Component IDs in React Experience Builder
DESCRIPTION: A code snippet showing how to maintain backward compatibility with older experiences by registering basic components with their previous IDs. This method should be run before rendering the first ExperienceRoot component.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/experience-builder-sdk/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
import { maintainBasicComponentIdsWithoutPrefix } from '@contentful/experiences-sdk-react';
maintainBasicComponentIdsWithoutPrefix();
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using maintainBasicComponentIdsWithoutPrefix Method in React
DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to maintain backward compatibility for basic components after a breaking change that added a 'contentful' prefix to component IDs. The function needs to be called early in the application initialization, before any ExperienceRoot components are rendered.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/core/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
import { maintainBasicComponentIdsWithoutPrefix } from '@contentful/experiences-sdk-react';
maintainBasicComponentIdsWithoutPrefix();
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Legacy Component Support in React
DESCRIPTION: Code snippet showing how to maintain backwards compatibility for experiences using basic components without the contentful prefix. This helper should be called before rendering the first ExperienceRoot component.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/visual-editor/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
import { maintainBasicComponentIdsWithoutPrefix } from '@contentful/experiences-sdk-react';
maintainBasicComponentIdsWithoutPrefix();
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Environment Variables for Experience Builder Test Apps
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the required environment variables to set up in the env.local file for using the Experience Builder test apps. It includes variables for Contentful space, environment, access tokens, and experience type.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
VITE_CTFL_ENVIRONMENT=
VITE_CTFL_SPACE=
VITE_CTFL_ACCESS_TOKEN=
VITE_CTFL_PREVIEW_ACCESS_TOKEN=
VITE_CTFL_DOMAIN=contentful.com
VITE_CTFL_EXPERIENCE_TYPE=
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Text Component with Custom HTML Tag
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the 'as' prop to specify a custom HTML tag for the text element.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/components/src/components/Text/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
<Text as="span">My Text</Text>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Label Prop with Button Component
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates using the label prop to specify button text. When the label prop is provided, it takes precedence over any children elements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/components/src/components/Button/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
<Button label="Go" />
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Storybook to Use Contentful Experiences Addon
DESCRIPTION: This TypeScript code snippet shows how to add the Contentful Experiences Storybook addon to the Storybook configuration file (.storybook/main.ts).
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/storybook-addon/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
const config: StorybookConfig = {
  stories: ['../src/**/*.mdx', '../src/**/*.stories.@(js|jsx|mjs|ts|tsx)'],
  addons: [
    '@storybook/addon-links',
    '@storybook/addon-essentials',
    '@contentful/experiences-storybook-addon', // <- add storybook plugin here
  ],
  // ... additional config
};
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Environment Variables for Contentful Experience Builder Demo
DESCRIPTION: This code block shows the environment variables that need to be set in the .env file for configuring the Contentful Experience Builder demo. It includes variables for the Contentful environment, space, access tokens, experience type, and domain.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/templates/nextjs-marketing-demo/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
NEXT_PUBLIC_CTFL_ENVIRONMENT=<environment>
NEXT_PUBLIC_CTFL_SPACE=<space>
NEXT_PUBLIC_CTFL_ACCESS_TOKEN=<access token>
NEXT_PUBLIC_CTFL_PREVIEW_ACCESS_TOKEN=<preview access token>
NEXT_PUBLIC_CTFL_EXPERIENCE_TYPE=<experience type>
NEXT_PUBLIC_CTFL_DOMAIN=<domain> (contentful.com (prod) or flinkly.com (staging))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Maintaining Backward Compatibility for Basic Component IDs in React SDK
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to maintain backward compatibility with older basic component IDs that don't have the Contentful prefix. This is needed after a breaking change in alpha.12 that updated component IDs with a Contentful prefix.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/experience-builder-sdk/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
import { maintainBasicComponentIdsWithoutPrefix } from '@contentful/experiences-sdk-react';
maintainBasicComponentIdsWithoutPrefix();
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Text Component with Children Prop
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates using the children prop to pass text content to the component.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/components/src/components/Text/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
<Text>My Text</Text>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Text Component with Value Prop
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the value prop to pass text content to the component.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/components/src/components/Text/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
<Text value="My Text" />
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Children Prop with Button Component
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the Button component with children instead of a label prop. The component accepts React nodes as children which will be displayed inside the button.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/components/src/components/Button/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
<Button>Go</Button>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Heading Component with Text Prop
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates using the Heading component with the text prop to display content.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/components/src/components/Heading/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
<Heading text="My Heading" />
```

TITLE: Configuring Environment Variables for NextJS Contentful Experience Test App

SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/test-apps/nextjs/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
 NEXT_PUBLIC_CTFL_ENVIRONMENT=<environment>
 NEXT_PUBLIC_CTFL_SPACE=<space>
 NEXT_PUBLIC_CTFL_ACCESS_TOKEN=<access token>
 NEXT_PUBLIC_CTFL_PREVIEW_ACCESS_TOKEN=<preview access token>
 NEXT_PUBLIC_CTFL_EXPERIENCE_TYPE=<experience type>
 NEXT_PUBLIC_CTFL_DOMAIN=<domain> (contentful.com (prod) or flinkly.com (staging))
```

----------------------------------------

DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows the required environment variables for configuring the Contentful Experiences Vite test app. These variables include Contentful space, environment, access tokens, experience type, and domain settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/test-apps/react-vite/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

VITE_CTFL_ENVIRONMENT=<environment>

VITE_CTFL_PREVIEW_ACCESS_TOKEN=<preview access token>
VITE_CTFL_EXPERIENCE_TYPE=<experience type>
VITE_CTFL_DOMAIN=<domain> (contentful.com (prod) or flinkly.com (staging))
```

TITLE: Basic URL Navigation with Button Component
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to configure the Button component to navigate to a URL when clicked. When the url prop is provided, the component wraps the button in an anchor tag.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/components/src/components/Button/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
<Button url="https://www.google.com" label="Go" />
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Contentful Studio Experiences Project with npm
DESCRIPTION: Command to create a new Contentful Studio Experiences project using npm. This initializes the project and guides the user through the setup process via interactive prompts.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/create-contentful-studio-experiences/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm init contentful-studio-experiences
```

LANGUAGE: bash

```

TITLE: Setting Target Attribute for Navigation
DESCRIPTION: Example of using the target prop to specify how the linked URL should open. The target prop works when a URL is provided and functions like a standard HTML anchor target attribute.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/components/src/components/Button/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
<Button url="https://www.google.com" target="_blank" label="Go" />
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Development Server for Next.js App Router Example

SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/examples/next-app-router/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:

  GATSBY_CTFL_SPACE=
  GATSBY_CTFL_ACCESS_TOKEN=
  GATSBY_CTFL_PREVIEW_ACCESS_TOKEN=
  GATSBY_CTFL_EXPERIENCE_TYPE=
  GATSBY_CTFL_DOMAIN=
```

TITLE: Starting Development Server for AstroJS Studio Experiences Project

SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/examples/astrojs-ssr/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run dev
```

TITLE: Creating New Gatsby Site with TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: Shell command to initialize a new Gatsby site using the minimal TypeScript starter template via the Gatsby CLI.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/examples/gatsby/gatsby-spa/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# create a new Gatsby site using the minimal TypeScript starter
npm init gatsby -- -ts
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Gatsby Development Server

SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/examples/gatsby/gatsby-spa/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cd my-gatsby-site/
npm run develop
```

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
<Heading>My Heading</Heading>
```

TITLE: Starting Gatsby Development Server for Studio Experiences

SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/examples/gatsby/gatsby-ssg/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run start
```

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for Next.js Studio Experiences
DESCRIPTION: Command to install necessary dependencies for the Next.js application using npm package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/examples/next-pages-router/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install
```

TITLE: Starting the Development Server for Contentful Studio Experiences
DESCRIPTION: Commands to navigate to the newly created project directory and start the development server. This allows for local development and testing of Studio Experiences.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/create-contentful-studio-experiences/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd studio-experiences-react-app
npm run dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Example Apps for Studio Experiences in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This markdown snippet lists and briefly describes two example applications that demonstrate the use of Studio Experiences with different Next.js routing methods. It covers both the App Router and Pages Router examples.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/examples/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# Studio Experiences example apps

This folder contains example apps that demonstrate how to use Studio Experiences with different frameworks.

## next-app-router

Demonstrates how to set up a server rendered page with Studio Experiences using the Next.js App Router.

## next-pages-router

Demonstrates how to set up a server rendered page with Studio Experiences using the Next.js Pages Router.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing Storybook Assets and Components
DESCRIPTION: Imports required assets and components for the Storybook introduction page, including SVG icons and the Meta component from Storybook blocks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/storybook-addon/src/stories/Introduction.mdx#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
import { Meta } from '@storybook/blocks';
import Code from './assets/code-brackets.svg';
import Colors from './assets/colors.svg';
import Comments from './assets/comments.svg';
import Direction from './assets/direction.svg';
import Flow from './assets/flow.svg';
import Plugin from './assets/plugin.svg';
import Repo from './assets/repo.svg';
import StackAlt from './assets/stackalt.svg';
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Storybook Page Styling
DESCRIPTION: Defines the CSS styling for the introduction page, including responsive grid layouts, link items, typography, and interactive hover states. The styles are scoped to specific components and include media queries for responsive design.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/storybook-addon/src/stories/Introduction.mdx#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: CSS
CODE:
```
.subheading {
  --mediumdark: '#999999';
  font-weight: 700;
  font-size: 13px;
  color: #999;
  letter-spacing: 6px;
  line-height: 24px;
  text-transform: uppercase;
  margin-bottom: 12px;
  margin-top: 40px;
}

.link-list {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: 1fr;
  grid-template-rows: 1fr 1fr;
  row-gap: 10px;
}

@media (min-width: 620px) {
  .link-list {
    row-gap: 20px;
    column-gap: 20px;
    grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr;
  }
}

@media all and (-ms-high-contrast:none) {
.link-list {
    display: -ms-grid;
    -ms-grid-columns: 1fr 1fr;
    -ms-grid-rows: 1fr 1fr;
  }
}

.link-item {
  display: block;
  padding: 20px 30px 20px 15px;
  border: 1px solid #00000010;
  border-radius: 5px;
  transition: background 150ms ease-out, border 150ms ease-out, transform 150ms ease-out;
  color: #333333;
  display: flex;
  align-items: flex-start;
}

.link-item:hover {
  border-color: #1EA7FD50;
  transform: translate3d(0, -3px, 0);
  box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.08) 0 3px 10px 0;
}

.link-item:active {
  border-color: #1EA7FD;
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}

.link-item strong {
  font-weight: 700;
  display: block;
  margin-bottom: 2px;
}

.link-item img {
  height: 40px;
  width: 40px;
  margin-right: 15px;
  flex: none;
}

.link-item span {
  font-size: 14px;
  line-height: 20px;
}

.tip {
  display: inline-block;
  border-radius: 1em;
  font-size: 11px;
  line-height: 12px;
  font-weight: 700;
  background: #E7FDD8;
  color: #66BF3C;
  padding: 4px 12px;
  margin-right: 10px;
  vertical-align: top;
}

.tip-wrapper {
  font-size: 13px;
  line-height: 20px;
  margin-top: 40px;
  margin-bottom: 40px;
}

.tip-wrapper code {
  font-size: 12px;
  display: inline-block;
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Version 1.9.0 Feature Update
DESCRIPTION: Release notes for version 1.9.0 detailing script cancellation handling functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
## [1.9.0](https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/compare/v1.8.2...v1.9.0) (2024-06-28)

### Features

TITLE: Specifying Contentful Host in CLI Command
DESCRIPTION: Command option to specify a custom Contentful host when running the CLI. This is useful for targeting different Contentful environments or regions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/create-contentful-studio-experiences/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
node dist/index.js --host <my_host>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running CLI in Development Mode
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the CLI in development mode, which performs cleanup operations after execution. This includes revoking generated auth tokens and deleting bootstrapped projects.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/create-contentful-studio-experiences/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
node dist/index.js --dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Next.js Development Server
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Next.js development server for local development and testing of the Studio Experiences implementation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/examples/next-pages-router/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run dev
```

TITLE: Using Existing API Token with CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command option to provide an existing Contentful API CLI token when running the tool. This avoids the need to generate a new token during the setup process.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/create-contentful-studio-experiences/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
node dist/index.js --token <my_token>
```

TITLE: Configuring ESLint with React Plugin
DESCRIPTION: Extended ESLint configuration that incorporates React-specific linting rules. Sets up React version, adds the React plugin, and enables recommended React linting rules including JSX runtime configurations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/contentful/experience-builder/blob/development/packages/templates/react-vite-ts/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// eslint.config.js
import react from 'eslint-plugin-react'

export default tseslint.config({
  // Set the react version
  settings: { react: { version: '18.3' } },
  plugins: {
    // Add the react plugin
    react,
  },
  rules: {
    // other rules...
    // Enable its recommended rules
    ...react.configs.recommended.rules,
    ...react.configs['jsx-runtime'].rules,
  },
})
```
